wikipedia_page.main: George Jeffrey "Jeff" Norman (born 6 February 1945 in Leigh, Lancashire) is a male British long-distance, cross country and fell runner.

link_mentions.page: List of British records in athletics
Athletics at the 1978 Commonwealth Games – Men's marathon

response: He entered the 1972 Maxol Marathon in Manchester but his finish in 2:23:04 hours was only worth 36th place. He had better long-distance performances in his later career, taking the 10-mile Snowdon Race in 1977 and 1978 before being beaten into second place by Jeff Norman in 1979. His best marathon outing was at the 1979 Grandma's Marathon, which he won in a time of 2:14:44 hours. He was an accomplished fell runner, setting a long-lasting course record for the Lantern Pike fell race in addition to wins at the Fairfield horseshoe and Darwen moors races.RICKY WILDE and his records. t42. Retrieved 2018-02-03. Other notable performances were a win at the 1978 Paavo Nurmi Marathon and runner-up finishes at the Juan Muguerza Memorial and Campaccio cross country races.Richard Wilde. Association of Road Racing Statisticians. Retrieved 2018-02-03.

But it is his local Rivington Pike fell race that Ravald is most proud of winning. In 1964 and 1967 Ravald had finished 3rd. In 1977 Ravald finished second between first placed Alan Blinston and Jeff Norman. Finally in 1979 he won the race.
